category.term: 3062~Twilight: Breaking Dawn~The Twilight Saga~The Hunger Games
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Friday was a very big night for US Twilight fans. Twihards across the nation left the comfort of their Team Edward-wallpapered bedrooms to attend midnight parties at Target for the DVD release of Breaking Dawn, Part 1. The department store rewarded their devotion by debuting a never-before-seen clip from Breaking Dawn, Part 2, and -- thanks to the power of shaky cellphone cameras – it's now burning up the interwebs.

The dialogue is hard to hear (and the picture is partially – and hilariously – obscured by a "Price Cut: $699.99" sign stuck on the TV), but the scene appears to feature newly turned Bella adjusting to vampire life (which is clearly suiting her. If becoming a vampire means lush eyelashes and voluptuous hair, drain us now!).

Bella is reading Alice's warning note about the Volturi ("Gather as many witnesses as you can before the snow sticks to the ground. That's when they'll come for us") when Edward enters the room.

"It's strange," she tells him. "Physically I feel like I could demolish a tank, but mentally I just feel...drained.

"How about a bath?" Edward answers before admitting, "I have a bad habit of underestimating you. Every obstacle you've ever faced I didn't think you'd overcome it, but you just did. And you've given me something to fight for: a family."

The first full trailer will run before screenings of The Hunger Games, which hits theatres in March.

What do you think of the clip below? Feel free to spaz out in the comments section.

jenm@dose.ca
